Comment: Meyer indicates he wants an open game, quickly tactical.
An old-fashiooned variant. 2 N-KB3 supplanted this move in popularity around 1830.
Countering symmetrically. 2... N-KB3 is the most solid response, but this move is acceptable.
If properly defensed, this move should not be a threat. But Newcomb fails to properly defense it.
An error. The correct move was 3... N-KR3, to be followed up with 4... O-O neutralizing any chance of a quick mate and leaving White's Q dangerously exposed.
Meyer pounces on the mistake. Black's position is already crumbling.
The alternatives aren't much better. There's no way to avoid losing the KR.
The King-hunt is on in earnest.
6... K-K2 would have prolonged the game, but Newcomb's position was hopeless anyway.
Mercifully putting Black out of his misery.
